tweets.text:
More habitat removal!
More mixed messages from the @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency
Please, please, please stop referring to habitat as blockages!! Please stop removing habitat from rivers!

@EAGeomorphology @BiodiversityEA @WildTroutTrust @theriverstrust https://t.co/U3Bl3M2wkB

tweets.text:
Are you new to #NaturalFloodManagement and funding? If so, then we need your help. We‚Äôre working on a project to make it easier for people to find funding for #NFM projects and would love to hear your thoughts. 

If you can help, get in touch here üëâhttps://t.co/jRjHj3kY35 https://t.co/PNPrSQBsfU
@Chris_Kenworthy @marketinghumber @EnvAgency We agree and are working towards that in Hull with our @OHOF6 project

Hurry, the early-bird discount for #WasteManagement2020 ends this Friday! This virtual event will include presentations from the @EnvAgency @VertaseFLI @hydrocknews @atkinsglobal @gunnercooke & more

Book: https://t.co/PYvYmxeH2o

Supported by @CIWM @ESA_tweets & @britishdrilling https://t.co/sYiyLPLTKF

Our Cheshire Field Team have been clearing out this watercourse on Sealand Road #Chester. Keeping watercourses free from blockages can be one of our first defences against #flood risk

Are you prepared for winter weather? Sign up for free flood warnings üëâhttps://t.co/pjHA6Ga6Uz https://t.co/Y1feCqqsxp

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency autocorrect again. Bankside of course still doesn‚Äôt explain why @EnvAgency have to knee-jerk clear away debris dams. Should be an opportunity to start river restoration. Actually needs to be a policy that 25m either side of watercourses no conventional farming. Imagine that!

We have been training our contractors so they can provide additional support during the winter months.

We set them a short notice task to test how quick they could respond to blockages - we were happy with the results. 

Before and after picsüì∏ #Peterborough #winter https://t.co/9Z4eH6CfAo

tweets.text: American signal crayfish. Beautiful and amazing creatures but total destroys of English rivers. Male and egg-carrying female here. It only takes a couple of eggs on survey gear, or wellies or fishing gear to enable them to destroy a new river. https://t.co/slP4Otlwvf

tweets.text:
We are collecting data from monitoring equipment at Narborough Bogs Nature Reserve #Leicestershire.

This helps us see how natural flood management techniques are slowing the flow of water along River Soar. It‚Äôs part of a ¬£15m national project #flood https://t.co/kmmnvQK4tA https://t.co/Xwui9eYEBA

@NOLALeyda @N_Rivers_Trust @stuartpengs @ShamsGalib @EnvAgencyAnglia @banhamzoo @WildTroutTrust @Eleri_Pritchard @Dan_Chadwick1 @DrCrayfish Oh, I didn't realise nutrias were a problem there too!Thankfully somehow we have managed to eradicate them here but we're a tiny island compared to you guys.

Out today in #Corby doing a static checksite. With colleagues from @DVSAEnforcement and @EnvAgency checking vehicles and their roadworthiness! 

#OpJourney https://t.co/CN94OmpBNU

@GlavenEel @N_Rivers_Trust @stuartpengs @ShamsGalib @EnvAgencyAnglia @banhamzoo @WildTroutTrust @Eleri_Pritchard @Dan_Chadwick1 @DrCrayfish Nonatives can be devastating. Here we have a problem nutria rats, introduced for their fur many decades ago. Now they destroy crucial banks and water plants. State pays people for pelts, but still a big problem. 

I fret about ocean farmed salmon, other fish. :-(

tweets.text: @CRTvolunteers @HighwaysSEAST @WalAbbeyNews @murrayscott06 @Habgas @thisisyourriver @EnvAgency Here we go again, fly tipping under the M25 bridge, Waltham Abbey. A bit much for us old pensioners. Do something about it Highways - fence the area off! https://t.co/XTTSLRLY0r
This photo shows where previous year's gravels have deposited and are creating habitat for inverts and fish #riverhealth #fishhealth #BringingRiversToLife 2/3 https://t.co/k9ANrWIIVH

Users can now investigate a wider range of scenario uncertainty with an update to the #UKCP18 Global (60 km) climate model simulations to include a low emissions scenario (RCP 2.6). Find out moreüëâhttps://t.co/g33qGh923c 

@beisgovuk @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency https://t.co/5BOQTAzf0P

@NOLALeyda @N_Rivers_Trust @stuartpengs @ShamsGalib @EnvAgencyAnglia @banhamzoo @WildTroutTrust @Eleri_Pritchard @Dan_Chadwick1 @DrCrayfish They have also decimated our river banks by burrowing, causing siltation,as well as eating fish eggs,fry and reducing the quality of habitat for fish and invertebrates.People still keep spreading them illegally. We live in constant fear of losing our native crays :( 2/2

Knowing what your users need can make such a difference when designing digital services. Our recently upgraded ‚ÄúRegister as a waste carrier‚Äù service took exactly that approach, and the in-house team who did the work, led by @andrew_hick are really proud! https://t.co/aUF5oWMxrX

@NOLALeyda @N_Rivers_Trust @stuartpengs @ShamsGalib @EnvAgencyAnglia @banhamzoo @WildTroutTrust @Eleri_Pritchard @Dan_Chadwick1 @DrCrayfish Yes, red swamp and signal craws are also farmed here and were released as a food source. Nobody realised the absolute devastation they would cause on our rivers and native species. They have wiped out most of our native crayfish which have no immunity to crayfish plague. 1/2

@GlavenEel @N_Rivers_Trust @stuartpengs @ShamsGalib @EnvAgencyAnglia @banhamzoo @WildTroutTrust @Eleri_Pritchard @Dan_Chadwick1 @DrCrayfish Thanks. Here in south Louisiana, people catch, and even farm, crawfish. I didn‚Äôt know you guys had any native ones there! Plague would be disaster down here.

tweets.text: @NOLALeyda @N_Rivers_Trust @stuartpengs @ShamsGalib @EnvAgencyAnglia @banhamzoo @WildTroutTrust @Eleri_Pritchard @Dan_Chadwick1 @DrCrayfish No, it is very bad practice to remove them from site. You risk carrying crayfish plague to other locations which wipes out our native crayfish. You must have a permit to trap and move them to a licensed location for consumption.

Last few hours of voting and its neck and neck. How sweet would it be to win for Lancashire and Cumbria? 
Urgent - Please vote and share to keep our beaches beautiful 
VOTE https://t.co/HHIzHKHePM
Closes 12 noon @GrahamLiver
@BBCLancashire https://t.co/w7bN4GLGQ1

tweets.text: With the help of our volunteers we've finished treating Japanese knotweed within the catchment for this year.  It's good to see lots of native wildflowers recolonising areas of the river bank where the knotweed has been eradicated #inns #japaneseknotweed @YISF__INNS @EnvAgency üçÉ https://t.co/d5SC7dYVnI

We‚Äôve contributed to a project led by @EnvAgencyNW & @EdenRiversTrust which allows wildlife üêü to flourish AND protects the WCML in #Penrith from flooding, keeping important #freight & @TPEassist & @AvantiWestCoast trains üöû on the move.

WATCH our video: https://t.co/uHBmJ7L3SB https://t.co/XxfmcLYApt

@bill_brierley @carlsayerUCL @frankiecoed @Riverflies @EnvAgency @freshwaterbio ARMI is also a great example of a citizen science ‚Äúearly warning system‚Äù. Many volunteers care about the state of their rivers and want to help, but all too often their efforts - and data - go unnoticed. @Riverflies is a great exception to this üôÇ
@PippaGoldfinger @EnvAgency @perry_jims We'd love to get involved Pippa - our team are experts in global flood mapping!

Looking for a UK expert on flooding who‚Äôs a great public speaker. Possibly someone from @EnvAgency or an academic. 
@perry_jims

@EnvAgencyMids An already degraded and denuded watercourse that for a moment had some habitat diversity both in stream and backside, wiped out in a few hours. How does this chime with @EnvAgency and debris dams policy, river restoration projects. This is not the way forward for wetlands.

We @HeritageFundNOR are very glad to be contributing to this working with @ace_thenorth @HE_Yorkshire @HE_NorthWest @HE_NorthEast @EnvAgencyYNE @rogermarshOBE @spatialpublic. Rich and successful places #NorthTogether #CulturedNorth #Place https://t.co/oIOFcWlGzy
